name: Circle
description: The Circle object represents a circle shape in a two-dimensional coordinate system. Used for drawing graphics and specifying hit areas for containers. ```ts // Basic circle creation const circle = new Circle(100, 100, 50); // Use as hit area container.hitArea = new Circle(0, 0, 100); // Check point containment const isInside = circle.contains(mouseX, mouseY); // Get bounding box const bounds = circle.getBounds(); ``` - Defined by center (x,y) and radius - Supports point containment tests - Can check stroke intersections

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates a clone of this Circle instance. ```ts // Basic circle cloning const original = new Circle(100, 100, 50); const copy = original.clone(); // Clone and modify const modified = original.clone(); modified.radius = 75; // Verify independence console.log(original.radius); // 50 console.log(modified.radius); // 75 ```

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks whether the x and y coordinates given are contained within this circle. Uses the distance formula to determine if a point is inside the circle's radius. Commonly used for hit testing in PixiJS events and graphics. ```ts // Basic containment check const circle = new Circle(100, 100, 50); const isInside = circle.contains(120, 120); // Check mouse position const circle = new Circle(0, 0, 100); container.hitArea = circle; container.on('pointermove', (e) => { // only called if pointer is within circle }); ```

methods.name: strokeContains
methods.description: Checks whether the x and y coordinates given are contained within this circle including the stroke. ```ts // Basic stroke check const circle = new Circle(100, 100, 50); const isOnStroke = circle.strokeContains(150, 100, 4); // 4px line width // Check with different alignments const innerStroke = circle.strokeContains(150, 100, 4, 1);   // Inside const centerStroke = circle.strokeContains(150, 100, 4, 0.5); // Centered const outerStroke = circle.strokeContains(150, 100, 4, 0);   // Outside ```

params.name: distance <= radius + outerWidth && distance > radius - (width - outerWidth

methods.name: getBounds
methods.description: Returns the framing rectangle of the circle as a Rectangle object. ```ts // Basic bounds calculation const circle = new Circle(100, 100, 50); const bounds = circle.getBounds(); // bounds: x=50, y=50, width=100, height=100 // Reuse existing rectangle const rect = new Rectangle(); circle.getBounds(rect); ```

methods.name: copyFrom
methods.description: Copies another circle to this one. ```ts // Basic copying const source = new Circle(100, 100, 50); const target = new Circle(); target.copyFrom(source); ```

methods.name: copyTo
methods.description: Copies this circle to another one. ```ts // Basic copying const source = new Circle(100, 100, 50); const target = new Circle(); source.copyTo(target); ```
